results.title: The Mysteries of blood: haemostasis and blood coagulation
results.creator_credit: Masami Sugiyama, Eiji Murayama and Sakura Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: It is needless to point out the important role played by the blood for the maintenance of human life and health. In particular, the real fact about blood coagulation is one of the principal problems attracting the attention of modern medical science. This film is intended to show the complicated and clever functions concealed in the simple fact of blood coagulation. Several hitherto unsolved problems have been clarified and new spheres have been presented for future study by this film.

results.title: The Mysterians
results.creator_credit: Ishiro Honda, Tomoyuki Tanaka, Peter Riethof, Carlos Montalban and RKO Teleradio Pictures
results.brief_description: Homeless aliens from a ruined planet decide to make Earth their new home in this Japanese horror outing. Soon after the mysterious brainiacs, who arrive in giant flying saucers accompanied by an enormous death-ray spewing robotic bird, establish themselves in a special dome, they demand that the Earth men bring them lots of pretty women so they can start replenishing their depleted population. Special effects by Eiji Tsuburaya.

results.title: The Mutton birds of Bass Strait
results.brief_description: A study of the species of mutton bird which appear in large numbers in the Furneaux Islands off North east Tasmania, and which are the basis of a successful commercial undertaking on the Islands. The film depicts preparations for the breeding season, harvesting, cleaning, packing and distribution. Investigations into the biology the the mutton bird commenced in 1947 to determine whether intensive harvesting was depleting the rookeries.

results.title: The MutleyMedia Booth
results.brief_description: Provides a descriptive run-down of the machinations of the ACMI MutleyMedia Booth through a presentation taken from a walkthrough that will play on the Booth’s three screens. Two short films - Pneumatic andChinagirl - embedded in the presentation represent the 16 original works by Australian artists made for screening insdie the Booth.

results.title: The Musicians in the woods
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: Animated puppets enact the Grimm fairy tale about the forsaken animals who set out to make their way in the world. The adventures in which the donkey, cat, dog, and rooster outwit a band of htieves and gain a fortune is told here in colorful and amusing fashion.

results.title: The Musical ride
results.creator_credit: National Film Board of Canada and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: A 1955 film presentation of the famous Musical Ride of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police. In a display of brilliant horsemanship, scarlet-coated Mounties take their horses through the many intricate patterns of the Ride, performed to the accompaniment of band music.

results.title: The Musical cartoon show. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: Presented with “Bold King Cole” (1936), starring the mischievous cartoon character Felix the Cat, are a selection of other cartoons from that by-gone-era of the 30s. All presented here are from Castle Films or directed, produced by the now legendary Ub Iwerks; Max and Dave Fleischer. Sit back and enjoy: “Happy days”, “Musical memories”, “The Pincushion man”, “The Wee men”, “A King’s Tailor” and the well-known fairy tale, “Jack and the beanstalk.”

results.title: The Music theatre = children's music theatre
results.creator_credit: Terry Byan and Television One (New Zealand)
results.brief_description: Four children’s musical favourites make up this colourful series which features the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra and some of New Zealand’s leading actors and dancers. “Tubby the tuba” tells the story of a tuba who is the ugly duckling of the orchestra. “The Sorcerer’s apprentice” Bored with the daily chores, an apprentice sorcerer seizes the opportunity to apply sorcery to his housework and ends up in trouble. “Peter and the wolf” Prokofiev’s musical introduction to the orchestra tells of Peter and his first encounter with a wolf. “Carnival of the animals” Imaginatively costumed animal characters saunter and cavort in a visually exciting production of the well loved music of Saint-Saens.

results.title: The Music teacher = Le Maitre de musique
results.creator_credit: Gerard Corbiau, Jacqueline Pierreux, K2-One and Belgian Television
results.brief_description: A poignant love story, a pulse-pounding international music competition, and music of timeless beauty is featured in this enthralling tale of talent and romance. Shortly before the Great War, celebrated singer Joachim Dallaryc (played by real-life opera star Jose Van Dam) suddenly announces his retirement from the stage, leaving the opera world stunned. Only the fabulously wealthy and diabolical Prince Scotti, his lifelong rival, gloats. Dallaryc retreats to the country devoting himself to training two young singers, the beautiful Sophie, who falls in love with him, and Jean, a retired thief who falls in love with Sophie. Their unrelenting and rigorous apprenticeship ends when Sophie and Jean are invited to an international singing competition staged by Prince Scotti. It will lead to either fame and riches - or to Prince Scotti’s revenge for his defeat by their teacher in a singing competition two decades before.

results.title: The Music school
results.creator_credit: John Korty, Dan McCann and Learning in Focus
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
An adaptation of John Updike’s short story written in 1964 in which a middle aged writer attempts to find some meaning for his life. Narrated by Colleen Dewhurst.
